definition: between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent

sentences.english: There was a folk story as follows.
Folk memories are oral traditions handed down over the years by word of mouth.
sentences.chinese: 民間故事是許多年來人們口頭承傳下來的一些傳統。

sentences.english: This practice came from an ancient folktale.
sentences.chinese: 這個習慣來源於古代的民間故事。

sentences.english: National hero is the main eulogizing object in mythic epics and folk stories.
sentences.chinese: 民族英雄是神話史詩與民間故事歌頌傳揚的主要對象。

sentences.english: Folktales is a kind of cultural treasure collectively created out of people's daily life, reflecting their real life.
sentences.chinese: 民間故事是人們在日常生活中集體創作的文化財富。

sentences.english: Folktale reflects demotic ideas about value.
sentences.chinese: 民間故事反映民衆的價值觀念。

sentences.english: North-eastern Gaomi county embodies China's folk tales and history.
sentences.chinese: 高密東北鄉體現了中國的民間故事和歷史。

sentences.english: There is hardly a valley or mountainside where folk cannot tell you of some one pillaged from amongst them.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎每個山谷或是山麓都不乏關於擄掠的民間故事。

sentences.english: "Tiger Mother"-type stories are famous folktales with worldwide significance.
sentences.chinese: “老虎母親”型故事是具有世界意義的著名民間故事。

sentences.english: A Valentines' Day story adapted from a folktale of unknown origin.
sentences.chinese: 一個情人節的故事改編自民間故事的起源不明。

sentences.english: It is a meaningful thing to collect, and edit folk stories.
sentences.chinese: 民間故事的採輯是件很有意義的事情。

definition: slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
